zone.line: my only friend, my hope, my shelter, I
will [in left margin] see it all with folded arms and down
cast eyes. You do not treat me with
candour; it is not true what you say;
this will not soon pass away, it will
last forever if you deign not to speak to
me; to admit my consolations.
"Dearest, dearest father, pity me –
pardon me: I entreat you do not drive
me to despair; indeed I must not be
repulsed; there is one thing that ^which although
although it may torture me to know,
yet that you must tell me. I de-
-mand, and most solemnly I demand if
in any way I am the cause of your
unhappiness. Do you not see my tears
which I in vain strive against – You
hear unmoved my voice broken by sobs –
Fell Feel how my hand trembles: my
whole heart is in the words I speak
and you must not endeavour to si-
lence me by mere words void ^barren of
meaning: the agony of my doubt hurries
me on, and you must reply. I beseech
and
